item.title: This Official Zelda-Themed Wireless Controller Is Only $25 At Amazon For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/this-official-zelda-themed-wireless-controller-is-only-25-at-amazon-for-black-friday/1100-6528017/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Legend of Zelda fans can score a pretty sweet deal on a wireless Nintendo Switch controller themed around the iconic action-adventure series. As part of Amazon's Black Friday Sale, PowerA's Legend of Zelda: Sworn Protector Bluetooth Controller is discounted to only $25, which is the best price yet for the $45 controller.

PowerA Wireless Switch Controller - Zelda: Sworn Protector

$25 (was $45)

Officially licensed by Nintendo, the Sworn Protector controller design is themed around Link's best-known weapons. The Hylian Shield and Master Sword from Ocarina of Time are emblazoned on the left grip. The off-white base color is accented by blue face buttons and triggers that match Link's shield. The red Hylian Crest in the center of the controller is a nice touch.

As for its technical features, the controller has two back buttons that can be remapped on the fly, which is a nice perk, especially in this price range. Since it connects via Bluetooth, you can also use it on PC and mobile devices. The controller does have an unusual quirk, though: It's powered by AA batteries. Your first pair is included, and you should get roughly 30 hours of playtime before you need to swap them out. Plus, you could always opt for rechargeable batteries, such as this Energizer kit with four batteries included for only $15 (50% off).

Third-party Switch controllers don't have NFC readers for Amiibo or HD rumble--this controller lacks rumble altogether. And while some PowerA Switch controllers have motion controls, this one does not.

If you want all of those features, you'll need to opt for Nintendo's Switch Pro Controller, which is on sale for $50 at multiple major retailers as part of Nintendo's official Black Friday deals. The Pro Controller is almost never discounted from its $70 price, so this best-ever deal is worth considering, too. You can also grab a pair of Neon Red and Blue Joy-Con Controllers for $60, down from $80.

Black Friday Zelda Merch Deals

The Legend of Zelda fans can also save on a wide variety of cool T-Shirts, hoodies, hats, and select collectibles. One of the standout deals is almost sold out: the Collector's Edition Hylian Shield statue from First 4 Figures. This 11.5-inch replica statue is made of PVC and comes with a magnetic display stand equipped with LED lights. This statue originally sold for $110, but you can add it to your display shelf for only $47.

item.title: Sonic X Shadow Generations Released A Month Ago, But It's Already Almost 50% Off
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/sonic-x-shadow-generations-released-a-month-ago-but-its-already-almost-50-off/1100-6527828/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A new Sonic movie is racing into theaters soon, and the best way to prepare for it is with a Black Friday discount on the recently released Sonic X Shadow Generations. For anyone who grew up with Sonic games in the 2010s specifically, this is a lovely remaster of 2011's Sonic Generations coupled with a brand-new campaign starring Shadow the Hedgehog. Sonic X Shadow Generations cost $50 when it launched exactly one month ago, but you can score it for just $30 on Switch, PS5, or Xbox Series X.

And if you want to rewatch the first two Sonic films before heading to the theater, Amazon has Sonic's 2-Film Collection on Blu-ray for only $16. Alternatively, you can score 4K editions of each film with limited-edition steelbook cases for only $24.85. To round out your collection, you can get Paramount's Knuckles miniseries on Blu-ray with a steelbook case for $28.79.

Sonic X Shadow Generations

$30 (was $50)

Sonic X Shadow Generations includes two games. First is a remaster of Sonic Generations, which is a celebration of Sonic throughout the ages with a mix of classic 2D levels inspired by the Blue Blur's Sega Genesis days and fast-paced 3D levels that feel like they were lifted directly from the Sonic Adventure games on the Dreamcast.

The other campaign is an all-new storyline where you play as Sonic's anti-hero counterpart, Shadow. Similar to Sonic's campaign, Shadow's stages play out across 2D and 3D arenas, but they feel different thanks to the powers you can unlock to help you overcome various obstacles in your way. This Amazon Black Friday deal is a great chance to add the game to your library for cheap.

The $20 discount is available at Amazon, Best Buy, and Target.

Sonic the Hedgehog Black Friday Game Deals

A few other Sonic games are also on sale for Black Friday if you feel like building a small library of speedy adventures, including Sonic Frontiers, which is a massive open world game that gives Sonic a big playground to speed around in, titanic boss fights, and a soundtrack that is incredibly metal. For a more classic Sonic feel, check out Sonic Origins Plus and Sonic Superstars, or you can get both Sonic Mania and Team Sonic Racing in a bundle deal for Switch.

Sonic the Hedgehog Lego Black Friday Deals

Some of Lego's Sonic the Hedgehog playsets and display models are on sale for Black Friday, including the 1,125-piece Green Hill Zone display model, which is up for grabs for $54.40 at Amazon. This is the largest Lego set, by piece count, featuring the classic Sega mascot. Meanwhile, Target has the adorable 393-piece Tails' Workshop and Tornado Plane playset for 50% off, dropping the price to only $20. It comes with four character figures: Sonic, Tails, Buzz Bomber, and Clucky. Sonic's Speed Sphere Challenge, which includes a functioning launcher to send Sonic flying, is also on sale for $20.

item.title: Upgrade Your Home Theater With These Black Friday Soundbar Deals
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/upgrade-your-home-theater-with-these-black-friday-soundbar-deals/1100-6528000/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you want to upgrade your home theater ahead of the holidays, both Best Buy and Amazon are offering great soundbar discounts for Black Friday. Whether you're searching for something premium or entry-level, there are some excellent deals to check out. One of our favorite deals is for the Samsung HW-C450 2.1 Channel Soundbar, as it’s listed for just $138 (was $198) and it should make a nice addition to most home theaters. Currently own a soundbar and want to make a serious upgrade? You’ll find a $600 Samsung soundbar discounted to $330.

Here’s a closer look at five of our favorite Black Friday soundbar deals, and for even more options, check out all the soundbar deals at Amazon and Best Buy.

After you've browsed the soundbar deals, take a moment to check out GameSpot's Black Friday hub for discounts on video games, anime, Lego sets, and much more.

Samsung HW-C450 2.1 Channel Soundbar

$138 (was $198)

The Samsung HW-C450 2.1 Channel Soundbar is a solid entry point for people seeking an upgrade to their built-in TV speakers. For just $138, it gets you a soundbar, wireless subwoofer, support for DTS Virtual:X, and an adaptive sound feature that automatically optimizes your audio based on the content. There’s also a game mode for improved directional audio. Toss in a remote that works with both Samsung TVs and your soundbar, Bluetooth connectivity, and a bass boost option to enhance the sound of explosions, and the HW-C450 is a great choice during Black Friday.

Samsung HW-C400/ZA 2.0 Channel C-Series Soundbar

$90 (was $120)

With a built-in subwoofer, support for Dolby Audio and DTS, and a useful “night mode” that reduces bass levels, the awkwardly named Samsung HW-C400/ZA is a decent choice at this new low price. The built-in subwoofer is especially nice for small spaces that might not have room for a wireless subwoofer.

Bose TV Soundbar

$199 (was $279)

This compact Bose soundbar is just 24 inches long, but its list of features is more impressive than you’d expect. Along with two angled full-range drivers for booming spatial audio and crisp dialogue, there’s a dedicated “dialogue mode” you can enable to make it easier to pick out words during quiet scenes. Beyond connecting to your TV, the soundbar supports Bluetooth connections--consider syncing it with your phone for your next party.

Samsung HW-Q600C 3.1.2 Channel Q-Series Soundbar

$330 (was $600)

This is one of our favorite deals for a premium soundbar, as it’s hard to beat the $270 price cut. Along with a wireless subwoofer, this soundbar supports Dolby Atmos, Q-Symphony, and offers a Game Mode Pro setting that improves its 360-degree audio. Toss in a nifty remote that works with both Samsung TVs and this soundbar, adaptive sound support for clearer dialogue, and easy setup with HDMI eARC, and it's easy to see why this is one of our favorite soundbar deals of Black Friday.

Vizio V-Series 2.0 Compact Soundbar

$55 (was $80)

At just 24 inches long, this Vizio is a good size for small setups. It’s also great for shoppers on a budget, as it packs in some great specs despite a price tag of just over $50. With support for Dolby Audio and DTS Virtual:X plus two full-range speakers, it should be a big improvement over most built-in TV speakers.
